meanings.definition: The practice of raising livestock on a large farm or estate.
meanings.sent1: Ranching involves taking care of animals on a big farm.
meanings.sent2: My family has been involved in ranching for generations.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cow start ranching? To show off its moo-ves!
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to ranching was as strong as the sturdy fences on the farm.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the ranching fields painted a peaceful picture.

meanings.definition: The business of operating a ranch.
meanings.sent1: She runs a successful ranching business in the countryside.
meanings.sent2: The ranching industry plays a vital role in our economy.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cowboy bring a ladder to the ranching business? He heard the stakes were high!
meanings.sent4: His mind was a ranching business, full of plans and strategies.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh hay filled the air at the bustling ranching business.

meanings.definition: The act of managing or working on a ranch.
meanings.sent1: Ranching requires hard work and dedication to the land.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys the challenges that come with ranching.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rancher bring a pillow to work? For a quick ranching nap!
meanings.sent4: Her heart was ranching, always longing for the open fields.
meanings.sent5: The sound of horses neighing echoed through the peaceful ranching landscape.
